Text.val: Author: Stephan Huppertz
11.04.2013 SH SCR18034 Removed leading ':' if not used as row identifier
04.06.2012 SH SCR17370 Extended length of v.RECOGNITIONSTRING to alpha 40
10.05.2012 SH SCR16665 Extended tests on row identifiers (now incl. trailing ':')
-- Write rows from file to database
... beginning of a statement
... starting balance of statement
... start of payment
... if the payment amount = 0, then the :61: row it's not an indication for a
new payment, only some additional payment descriptions (:86) are followed
... do not store these :62M: rows (end balance of current page)
... end of statement
... finally update statement with some extracted fields (see above)
... remaining rows of statement (payments and descriptions)
-- :61: rows (=payment) where the amount = 0 have not to be stored
to NFPC, these :61: rows are followed by extra :86: rows with extended
payment descriptions
-- Payment sign, could be at pos. 11 or 15 in bank file
-- If 'D' or 'C' is followed by non-numerical charaters these character have to
be ignored
-- Payment amount (until next non numerical charater)
.. extract amount first to string to remove possible leading zeroes, to avoid
an overflow in case of too many leading zeroes
... remove leading zeros
-- Remove leading ':' if it's not a row identifier
... remove leading zeros
